text: Wild Blue (Part I) is the fourth major label studio album released by American singer-songwriter Hunter Hayes, released on August 16, 2019 through Warner Music Nashville. Hayes co-produced and co-wrote every track on the album. ==Background== Hayes initially planned to release the album on October 11, 2019, the eighth anniversary of his first studio album, but in August 2019, Hayes made a surprise announcement on NBC's Today show revealing that the album would be released on August 16, 2019. The album is the first part of a trilogy of albums. The album has only been released digitally and to streaming platforms as of April 2020. ==Commercial performance== The album debuted at number 44 on Billboards Top Country Albums. It has sold 1,400 copies in the United States as of September 2019. ==Track listing== Track listing adapted from Rolling Stone. ==Personnel== Adapted from AllMusic. ==Charts== ===Album=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center" |- ! scope="col"| Chart (2019) ! scope="col"| Peak position |- |} ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2" style="width:10em"| Single ! colspan="1"| Peak chart positions |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! style="width:45px;"| US Country Airplay |- | 2019 | style="text-align:left;"| "Heartbreak" | 56 |} ==References== Category:2019 albums Category:Hunter Hayes albums Category:Warner Records albums
title: Wild Blue (Part I)
